questions.question: A crane lifts a 1,200 kg steel beam to a height of 25.0 m at a constant speed. If the operation takes 40.0 seconds, calculate the average power output of the crane in kilowatts (kW). (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A motorized cart is pushed against a constant resistive force of 450 N. If the motor maintains a steady speed of 12.0 m/s, what is the instantaneous power delivered by the motor in watts?
An electric winch has a power rating of 2.5 kW. How many seconds will it take for this winch to pull a crate along a floor if the total work required to overcome friction is 15,000 J?

A 85.0 kg firefighter climbs a vertical ladder to a height of 12.0 m. If the firefighter reaches the top in 15.0 seconds, calculate their average power output in both Watts and Horsepower (hp). (Use $1\text{ hp} = 746\text{ W}$, $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
A security floodlight is rated at 350 W. If the light remains on for exactly 8.0 hours, calculate the total energy consumed in Megajoules (MJ).

A 1,500 kg car accelerates from rest to a speed of 22.0 m/s in 6.0 seconds. Assuming the acceleration is uniform and ignoring air resistance, calculate the average power required to achieve this change in kinetic energy.

A water pump is required to lift 400 kg of water every minute from a well that is 15.0 m deep. Calculate the minimum power (in Watts) the pump must output to achieve this rate. (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)

A boat's engine provides 150 hp to maintain a constant cruising speed of 18.0 m/s. Calculate the total resistive force (drag) acting on the boat at this specific speed. (Convert hp to Watts first, $1\text{ hp} = 746\text{ W}$)

An escalator is designed to carry 25 people (average mass 70 kg each) per minute from the first floor to the second floor, a vertical rise of 6.0 m. What is the average power required by the escalator motor to lift the passengers? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Total mass = $25 \times 70 = 1,750$ kg. $W = 1,750 \times 10 \times 6 = 105,000$ J per minute. $P = 105,000/60 = 1,750$ W.

questions.question: A constant force of 180 N is applied to an object, moving it at a constant speed. If the power output is measured at 2.7 kW, calculate the speed of the object and the total distance it travels in 20.0 seconds.

scoreMessages.70: Good work! Review $P = W/t$ and $P = Fv$ formulas.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on converting between units and applying the correct formula.
scoreMessages.0: Let's review. Study the definition of power and its relationship to work and force.
